I'm sorry, but hearing them dramatically explain this "space plague" over footage of astronauts galloping across the surface of the moon is.....something 😂

At 7:00 there is film of the LEM lifting off from the moon's surface to rendevous back with the orbiter. BOTH astronauts would have had to have been onboard, yet the stationary camera set on the moon's surface about 50 yards from the LEM pans UPWARD to follow the LEM's ascension. HOW did that stationary camera pan upward on its own, since there were no humans on the surface to man it? How would a camera in 1972 KNOW that the object in focus was rising if not for someone physically following the object upward? Did NASA spend money on a remote controlled camera they were going to use once and leave behind forever? Seems highly unlikely and wasteful if that were true, and a camera that moved that smoothly on its own back in 1972 would have been one expensive piece of hardware. I see how people can think the landings were faked when you see anomalous shots like these.

Is it possible to even get a smell off the moon with the fully enclosed life support system? With 4-5# of positive pressurized oxygen could a smell in a vacuum be able to be detected by any astronaut? Experts chime in.

More than likely, the lunar regolith (which is a silica substance) filled the LEM with dust. This material is also electrically charged, and next to impossible to remove from clothing etc. Breathing this regolith dust is very hazardous and would be expected to cause breathing difficulties. Nasal blockage and a dry throat would also be expected, I suppose. The identical situation applies to the Martian surface, and both will continue to pose a hazard, till reliable methods of neutralising the electrical charge, and cleaning their clothing, ensuring a separation from crew quarters.
